reasoning: Wiskott-Aldrich Syndrome is an X-linked recessive genetic disorder with estimated incidence of 1-4 per million births, translating to extremely rare. Prevalence estimated at ~0.1 per 100k globally based on case registries. Using prevalence (not incidence) as appropriate for a chronic genetic condition.
source: Compiled from rare disease registries and case reports; no single comprehensive epidemiological study
